item.title: Mentioned by National Post
item.description:
Make political leaders endorse their own attack ads, Liberal MP proposes in ...
OTTAWA — In a bid to clean up negative “attack” ads, a Winnipeg Liberal member of Parliament has proposed a private member's bill that would force federal political leaders to personally endorse their party's political advertisements — but those leaders aren't exactly lining up to support him. A spokesperson for Liberal leader Justin Trudeau said Trudeau was too busy to comment on Bill C-524, introduced Tuesday by Liberal MP Kevin Lamoureux. NDP leader Tom Mulcair said the bill hasn't yet been discussed by ...

item.title: Mentioned by Macleans.ca
item.description:
Can you hear Kevin Lamoureux?
The good news is that reporters picked up on a couple of bills that have emerged from the House in recent days: Liberal MP Kevin Lamoureux's proposal that party leaders be forced to approve political ads; and Conservative MP John Williamson's suggestion ...

item.title: Mentioned by Toronto Star
item.description:
Liberal MP's political advertising bill would force party leaders to endorse attack ...
Kevin Lamoureux, a Liberal MP from Winnipeg, wants all political party leaders to be forced to stand by the content of their ads, with U.S.-style endorsements or tag lines at the end, acknowledging that approval for the advertising comes from the top.
